page.title: 12Southampton's River Test 1
page.content: The{Lower Test Valley Nature Reserve contains {640 acres}of reed beds, old unimproved water meadows, brackish grassland and salt marsh together with some improved farmland. It lies to the west of{Southampton}and is a Site of Special Scientific Interest. It is on lease to{Hampshire and Isle of Wight {Naturalists' Trust}. The area is very rich in floral species, over{450 species of plants} have been recorded. The bird life is abundant, over{170 species of birds} have been listed, including wintering wildfowl and waders. The area is safe refuge in severe weather, and there are important populations of breeding birds. The southern part of the reserve is under tidal influence.{Reed(Phragmites {communis)}forms one of most extensive reed beds found along the south coast.
